title.narrative: 2.3 ADVOCACY ON CHILD RIGHTS & PARTICIPATION, INCLUDING CHILDREN

description.narrative: 2.3 Civil society, Parliament and media are actively promoting the rights of adolescents and younger children, including engaging them to participate in discussions on areas that concern them, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.3 Civil society, Parliament and media are actively promoting the rights of adolescents and younger children, including engagingthem to participate in discussions on areas that concern them

description.narrative: With 2021 marking the 75th anniversary, UNICEF used all opportunities to highlight the risks for children and the evidence of increasing child poverty, learning crisis and worsening prospects towards achieving SDG targets for children, in a programming context marked by a difficult economic situation, the continued COVID-19 pandemic affecting all aspects of the society and the persistent political uncertainty. Following presentation of the 4th to 6th combined State Party report, in June 2021, the CRC issued Final Observations to Tunisia, a key advocacy ally for all stakeholders leading the child rights agenda. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
